metadata.title: CVE-2020-12400 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
When converting coordinates from projective to affine, the modularinversion was not performed in constant time, resulting in a possibletiming-based side channel attack. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nss package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7').
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
